a vow by a woman of not wearing green bangles, green sari (sīre, a garment worn by Hindu women, consisting of a long piece of cotton or silk wrapped around the body with one end draped over the head or over one shoulder), till the marriage of her first-born son.
any of several spots on the body of a woman by touching of which sexual desire is roused in her.
one of the two equal parts of a whole; a half.

(fig.) to punish to set someone right; to correct by punishing; ನೇರವಾಗಿಸು nēravāgisu = ನೇರಮಾಡು - 1, 2, 3 & 4; ನೇರವಾಗು nēravāgu to become straight; to become free from curves, angles, bends, etc.; 2. to become proper; 3. to be set on righteous path; to behave genuine, honest, upright or straightforward; 4. to become sufficient.

a vow of not marrying till one's death, and spending the life in persuasion of religious or philosophical knowledge.
a man who has taken a vow of not marrying till his death, and spending the life in persuasion of religious or philosophical knowledge.
a woman who has taken a vow of not marrying till her death, and spending the life in persuasion of religious or philosophical knowledge.
(vīr.) unwavering, loyal devotion to the god.
a monastery where people live a celibate life for religious purposes.

existing in or formed by nature; natural.
of or pertaining to nature or the universe; natural.
growing spontaneously, without being planted or tended by human hand, as vegetation; natural.
in conformity with the ordinary course of nature; not unusual or exceptional.
that which is natural.
that which is produced without human effort, care, etc.

a direct, sudden, and irresistible action of natural forces such as could not reasonably have been foreseen or prevented, as a flood, hurricane, earthquake or other natural catastrophe; an act or series of acts of god.
the moon, the king of nights.
a man holding or using a sword; a swordsman.
the quality of being unselfish; desirelessness; unselfishness.
a kind of plant.
an entering or recording in an official book; registration.

to extinguish a lamp, fire, etc.; to put off.
to put an end to; to destroy; to cause to die out.
to ward off; to fend off; to prevent (an evil) from happening to remove (it).

(pain, suffering, etc.) to become milder and gradually quenched.
to lose lustre; to become dull; to wither; to fade.
a wooden frame or bar with loops or bows at either end, fitted around the necks of a pair of oxen, etc. for tying, which forms a part of a plough or cart; a yoke.
a crude unit of linear measure, equal approximately to eight to ten feet.
the apparent blue canopy over our heads; the sky.
serfdom, slavery or subjection to some force, compulsion or influence.
the condition of being responsible or the thing that one is responsible for; responsibility.
a kind of archaic military weapon.
